intro: Psychotria hexandra var. rockii, commonly known as the "African arrow poison" or "Cape gooseberry," is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that are often fragrant. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that turns red when mature. The plant contains various alkaloids, some of which have been studied for their pharmacological properties.
